clues.text: Staring upward is a pastime approved by Gavin Pretor-Pinney, author of these "That Look Like Things" (dolphins, Alfred Hitchcock...)
This marketplace for securities & other investments was formally constituted in the Big Apple in 1817
The branchial hearts, 2 of the 3 in an octopus, pump blood through its gills, where this is released & oxygen is absorbed
Will Smith lived with his aunt & uncle in a posh home on St. Cloud Road in this title place
For 2024 this company rolled out a special 40th anniversary edition of its Jetta GLI
From Latin for "to write", it's to write or draw quickly & carelessly
SpellTower & WordBrain are online games akin to this one with cubes & hourglass that Peggy Hill mastered
One of the wealthiest widows in the colonies when she remarried, she was called "Patsy" by her new hubby George
When you pull a leg off this crustacean to eat, the fuzzy gray part is the gill; it has several pairs & yes, I'll have it Thermidor
1964 saw the premieres of both "The Addams Family" & this show also named for its fiendish-sounding family
Coco taxisas well as old classic cars are popular ways to get around this Caribbean nation
2-word term for a legal authorization to inspect a premises
Painful memories can hamper you--beware these such as your childhood bully's cologne, APA-defined as stimuli that elicit reactions
1649's Toleration Act passed by this colony's assembly was designed to ensure Catholics & Protestants could freely worship there
Using all its tools, the scalloped type of this shark suppresses gill use during dives & can hold its breath for about an hour
This show about the Korean War won only one Emmy as Best Comedy Series
By the end of the 1930s, this company named for its founder had a fleet of more than 50 trucks to rent out
There's a flock animal in this adjective meaning showing embarrassment
Sorry son, missed your soccer tournament playing L4D2, this Deep South-set horror video game
Using an innovative boring technique in 1859, Edwin Drake had the first successful one of these & soon the boom was on
Gills aren't part of the name of these fish, subclass Dipnoi, but they actually have them & use them
Beginning in 1978 Bill Bixby took no shirt after getting angry on this show
Now more of a tourist novelty, reindeer sledding used to be common transportation for this 4-letter people of Lapland
As a verb, it means to make an extravagant purchase, perhaps leading to accusations of squandering
Sorry son, missed your video game tournament watching Euro 2024 soccer from this city's 1936 Olympiastadion
It's the CT in the WCTU, long headed byFrances Willard, but even drunk atheists admire Fran's push for voting rights & an 8-hour workday
From Greek & Latin for "naked gills", thenudibranch, better known by this alliterative name, has gills on its back
A footnote to history: magician Fred Kaps followed The Beatles on his Feb. 9, 1964 show; Fred really had to make magic happen!

Abrupt or disconnected, like a music performance style

Better known for her mysteries, she wrote a handful of romance novels under the name Mary Westmacott

The Heimlich isn't medicine's only one of these; if you have tachycardia, the doctor may ask you to perform the Valsalva one
The national flag of Sri Lanka features 4 bo leaves & a lion wielding one of these weapons
The sunny south beat the frozen north when the Hurricanes defeated this Edmonton team in the 2006 Stanley Cup Finals
In May 2024 these 2 competitors went back & forth with tracks like "Family Matters" & "Meet The Grahams"
Born in Wales to Norwegian parents, he was named for explorer Amundsen
In 2021 a Hennepin County jury convicted former police officer Derek Chauvin on 3 counts related to the death of this man
"Neither shall thou mar the corners of" this, the Lord told Moses; that's why Eastern Orthodox priests so often have one
The eagle that appears on Albania's flag has this unnatural distinction
Its atomic number is 99 & its name honors one of the most famous scientists ever
On "Hit 'Em Up" this rapper dissed Biggie Smalls & repped the "Westside"
This "Brave New World" author was the grand-nephew of poet & critic Matthew Arnold
It took some 200 potential jurors to fill 12 seats in the case brought against Donald Trump by this Manhattan D.A.
One reason rockers switch out guitars onstage is this is different for some songs, such as 1/2 step down from the standard E-A-D-G-B-E
Flags depicting a map of the nation itself includethisBalkan country that broke away from Serbia in 2008
2-word term for the beat of Milton's "Paradise Lost"

C.S. Lewis was Clive Staples; this "Hornblower" author was Cecil Scott

In the mid-1800s Peru brought in 100,000 Chinese laborers, many mining for this fertilizer with a name from Quechua
Theflagof this Central American nation has an ax, a ship & a motto meaning "I flourish in the shade", but no more Union Jack
A wine connoisseur, from the Greek for wine & loving
The title of this hate letter from Nas to Jay-Z that shares its name with an anesthetic drug now means "to insult publicly"
This "Brideshead Revisited" author passed away on Easter Sunday in 1966, soon after returning home from mass
In 1999 a Michigan jury convicted this doctor & euthanasia advocate of second-degree murder
Vilified in history, this king was loved in York; in 1485 he was "piteously slain... to the great heaviness" of that city
Seenhereis the flag of this nation on the Black Sea that may have been in use since the 14th century
A fairy who marries a mortal is the title character of this Gilbert & Sullivan operetta
